item.title: Frederick add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He got up. It was too early to go to bed; at least, he was not in the mood for it. He pined for a bit of amusement - something cheap and easy. A seat in the pictures, cigarettes, beer. Useless! No money to pay for any of them. He would read KING LEAR and forget this filthy century. Finally, however, it was THE ADVENTURES OF SHERLOCK HOLMES that he took from the mantelpiece. SHERLOCK HOLMES was his favorite of all books, because he knew it by heart. The oil in the lamp was giving out and it was getting beastly cold. Gordon dragged the quilt from his bed, wrapped it round his legs and sat down to read. His right elbow on the table, his hands under his coat to keep them warm, he read through "The Adventure of the Speckled Band." The little gas-mantle sighed above, the circular flame of the oil-lamp burned low, a thin bracket of fire, giving out no more heat than a candle." -- George Orwell

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy
